mdRecord.dcterms:title: Abe Lincoln's Union wagon / by James D. Gay, Army Song Dealer and Publisher, No. 300 North 20th St., Philadelphia, Pa. All of Gay's Army songs sent by Mail. ; Air: "Wait for the Wagon," or "Old Virginia low lands."
Eagle of Columbia in majesty and pride
Old Union wagon
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Also published under title "Old Union wagon." [original]
The title is over-printed on the imprint. [original]
Civil War song sheet, in 7 verses, with chorus which is printed only after the 1st verse; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First line of 4th verse reads "Brave Hancock's in the Wagon, Meade and Warren by his side." [original]

Hand-colored headpiece features a representation of Columbia on the left and, on the right, a portrait of Lincoln framed in a star against a background of flags, with a small vignette of the Capitol below; Magnus 8. Cf. American song sheets, 1736f. [original]
At end of text below border: Entered ... in the year 1864, by James D. Gay, in the Clerk's Office of the Eastern District of Pennsylvania. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Eleventh of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
